mods.note: ] BRITISH CONSULATE MUSCAT PILE NO: 9/22 NAME OP PILE: CM CM \ CT\ 9 M S (A in m CTn NAVAL & SHIPPING: MOVEMENTS OP OTHER FOREIGN WARSHIPS IN THE GULP.IX. % NAVAL AND SHIPPING. B. FOREIGN NAVY. ^ 5) Moveirinents of^/Foreign Warships in the Gulf. From To ( U^j ■■ A Telegram From - French Consul, Bombay. To - His Highness Sultan, Muscat. Dated 4th February 1935. I have the honour confirm letter dated 14th January concerning intended visit Muscat from 8th to 10th February French Aviso Bougainville with Hear Admiral Hive aboard. Would Your Highness let me know if have any objection. Telegram. From - Sultan's Hepresentative. To - French Consul, Bombay. Dated 5th February 1935. Telegram received no objection to visit Sultan expected arrive Muscat 6th February. Telegram Cr. From - Political, Muscat. To - Britconsul, nushire. No. 43. Dated 5th February 1935. Muscat Government informed me today that French sloop BOUGAINNILLE with Hear admiral RIVE is expected here 8th February to 10th February. Addressed to Political resident repeated Senior Naval Officer.Telegram Cr* From - Political, Muscat. To - Britconsul, Bushire. No. 45. Dated 7th February 1935. 3 © ky telegram of the 5th instant No.43. Presume I should call on admiral in spite of no warning being given. Please telegraph reply urgent. _ aL ACOM* IDisiNT IAL . No.C/^f).of 1936. Political Agency <k H.B.M's Consulate 9 Wuscfit 9 31th February 1936. i Prop* Major C.E.U,Brenmer f M.C. f Political Agent <& H.B.M's Consul y Muscat. T# The Hon’ble the Political Hesldent in the Persian Uulf, Bushlre. Subjecti- Visit of French sloop 'Bougainville** to Muscat. Sir, With reference to my telegram No.43 of 6th February on the above subject, I have the honour to state as follows 2. On the 6th instant Saiyid Shahab, His Highness's f Representative, wrote a private chit to the Agency Dragoman ^ asking him to come and see him. The request was made for the purpose of translating the telegram, of which a copy is appended herewith, and of dictating a reply. 3. No suggestion was made by Saiyid Shahab of intimating the Political Agent of its contents. The Dragoman, on reflection, asked if there was any objection to a copy of the telegram being taken. He was permitted to do so in spite of the protest of Saiyid ^ilal, the Representative^ Secretary, that **no necessity arose** to inform the Political Agent. From the context of the telegram the fact that a French sloop intended visiting Muscat must have been known to the local authorities on 22nd January unless the letter, posted, in Bombay by the French Consul, was delivered by the Postal authorities direct to the Sultan in Bombay. In either case no intimation was conveyed to the Political Agent.- 2 - v 5* Admiral Rivet, commanding the French Naval Forces at Beyrout, regretted that he could not intimate the time of his arrival as he was unaware that W/T existed at Tnuscat* He made no allusion to preparatory arrangements ( for his visit, other than briefly stating that it ha^l been fixed up by the French Consul in Bombay* I gathered that he had not met the Buitan previous to his arrival in Muscat 6* Although a time was arranged mutually for the Admiral's call on the Sultan, no arrangement for his landing (in torrential rain) was maae by the State. The Agency whaler was fortunately handy and transhipped the Admiral and his staff to the Customs. Admiral Rivet commented on the State's lack of courtesy and expressed his warm thanks to the Political Agent when subsequently returning the latter's call. 7. No hospitality was extended by the Sultan or the State to the w Bougainville' but the Political Agent entertained the Admiral and his staff to dinner and preferred other hospitality to the ship's officers. Admital Rivet gave a lunch party on board to which the Political Agent, Medical Officer and American missionaries were invited, 8. The subsequent itinerary of the 'Bougainville' from Muscat was telegraphed to you and the Senior Naval Officer, Persian U ulf. I have the honour to be. Sir, Your most obedient servant, /T. Major, Political Agent & H.B.M's Consul, Muscat* ASH*

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 9/22 Naval & Shipping: Movements of other foreign warships in the Gulf'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order, from the front to the rear.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 7; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-7; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: Correspondence concerning the visit of French naval vessel Bougainvilleto Muscat. The correspondence is between the Political Agent in Muscat, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, French Consul in Bombay [Mumbai], and representatives of the Sultan of Muscat. The papers cover notice of the impending visit and the Political Agent's brief report of proceedings (folios 5-6).

name.namePart: Sultan of Muscat and Oman, Āl Bū Sa'īd Dynasty
